title: Ukraine War Hits World’s Farmers as Russia Cuts Fertilizer Supplies, Hurting Brazil
sub_head: Shortages and higher costs take a toll on the top producer of crops including sugar, soy and coffee, threatening to spur global food inflation
body:
SÃO PAULO—Brazil is searching for new fertilizer suppliers as the war in Ukraine threatens to cut off shipments to one of the world’s breadbaskets, with potential ripple effects on already high global food inflation.
The Latin American country is the largest producer of coffee, soybeans and sugar, and the most dependent of the world’s agricultural superpowers on imported fertilizer. Brazil imports some 85% of its fertilizers and about a fifth of those imports come from Russia. The Russian trade ministry has called for a broad suspension of fertilizer exports, state news agency TASS reported Friday.
